adjectives.description: uncrisp (comparative more uncrisp, superlative most uncrisp)

entries.meaning: Not possessing firmness and freshness or brittleness (especially of foods).
Not quick, precise, accurate or well-defined.
(dated) Not curling in stiff curls or ringlets (of hair).

verbs.description: uncrisp (third-person singular simple present uncrisps, present participle uncrisping, simple past and past participle uncrisped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become less or not crisp.
examples: [The] metal [of the coach], jouncing on the track, massaged his behind and his pants, uncrisping, were as wet from the mangy dog as from the sweat pouring out between his legs.

entries.meaning: (transitive, dated) To stop contorting or tensing (a part of one's body); to cause to be no longer contorted or tensed.
(intransitive, dated) To stop being contorted or tensed (of a part of the body).
(transitive, archaic) To stop (something) from rippling or undulating.
examples: Behold your Neptune, with his Trident there,
Vncrisps the Billows, smoothing them like Glass;
